trans-unit.source: Manage Role Based Access Control (RBAC) with Azure CLI | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage Role Based Access Control (RBAC) with Azure CLI | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage role-based access (RBAC) with the Azure command line interface by listing roles and role actions, assigning roles to the subscription and application scopes.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage role-based access (RBAC) with the Azure command line interface by listing roles and role actions, assigning roles to the subscription and application scopes.

trans-unit.source: Manage Role Based Access Control (RBAC) with the Azure Command Line Interface (CLI)
trans-unit.target: Manage Role Based Access Control (RBAC) with the Azure Command Line Interface (CLI)

trans-unit.target: Once you have identified the role you wish to assign, to grant access use:

trans-unit.source: Assign role to group at subscription scope
trans-unit.target: Assign role to group at subscription scope

trans-unit.source: To assign a role to a group at the subscription scope use:
trans-unit.target: To assign a role to a group at the subscription scope use:

trans-unit.source: azure role assignment create --objId <group's object id> --role
trans-unit.target: azure role assignment create --objId <group's object id> --role

trans-unit.source: --scope <subscription/subscription id>
trans-unit.target: --scope <subscription/subscription id>

trans-unit.source: The following example assigns the *Reader* role to *Christine Koch's Team* at the *subscription* scope.
trans-unit.target: The following example assigns the *Reader* role to *Christine Koch's Team* at the *subscription* scope.

trans-unit.target: Assign role to application at subscription scope

trans-unit.target: To assign a role to an application at the subscription scope use:

trans-unit.target: Following example grants the *Contributor* role to an *Azure AD* application on the selected subscription.

trans-unit.target: Assign role to user at resource group scope

trans-unit.target: To assign a role to a user at the resource group scope use:

trans-unit.source: Remove access
trans-unit.target: Remove access

trans-unit.source: To remove a role assignment, use:
trans-unit.target: To remove a role assignment, use:

trans-unit.source: Following example removes the *Virtual Machine Contributor* role assignment from *sammert@aaddemo.com* on the *Pharma-Sales-ProjectForcast* resource group.
trans-unit.target: Following example removes the *Virtual Machine Contributor* role assignment from *sammert@aaddemo.com* on the *Pharma-Sales-ProjectForcast* resource group.

trans-unit.source: Then, it removes the role assignment from a group on the subscription.
trans-unit.target: Then, it removes the role assignment from a group on the subscription.

trans-unit.source: Create a custom role
trans-unit.target: Create a custom role

trans-unit.source: To create a custom role, use `azure role create` command.
trans-unit.target: To create a custom role, use `azure role create` command.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates a custom role called *Virtual Machine Operator* that grants access to all read operations of *Microsoft.Compute*, *Microsoft.Storage*, and *Microsoft.Network* resource providers, and grants access to start, restart, and monitor virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The following example creates a custom role called *Virtual Machine Operator* that grants access to all read operations of *Microsoft.Compute*, *Microsoft.Storage*, and *Microsoft.Network* resource providers, and grants access to start, restart, and monitor virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: The custom role can be used in two subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: The custom role can be used in two subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: This example employs a json file as an input.
trans-unit.target: This example employs a json file as an input.

trans-unit.source: ![](./media/role-based-access-control-manage-access-azure-cli/2-azure-role create-1.png)
trans-unit.target: ![](./media/role-based-access-control-manage-access-azure-cli/2-azure-role create-1.png)

trans-unit.source: Modify a custom role
trans-unit.target: Modify a custom role

trans-unit.source: To modify a custom role first, use the azure role show command to retrieve role definition.
trans-unit.target: To modify a custom role first, use the azure role show command to retrieve role definition.

trans-unit.source: Then, make desired changes to the role definition.
trans-unit.target: Then, make desired changes to the role definition.

trans-unit.source: Finally, use azure role set command to save the modified role definition.
trans-unit.target: Finally, use azure role set command to save the modified role definition.

trans-unit.source: The following example adds the Microsoft.Insights/diagnosticSettings/* operation to the Actions, and an Azure subscription to the AssignableScopes of the Virtual Machine Operator custom role.
trans-unit.target: The following example adds the Microsoft.Insights/diagnosticSettings/* operation to the Actions, and an Azure subscription to the AssignableScopes of the Virtual Machine Operator custom role.

trans-unit.source: Delete a custom role
trans-unit.target: Delete a custom role

trans-unit.source: To delete a custom role first, use the `azure role show` command to determine the **Id** of the role.
trans-unit.target: To delete a custom role first, use the `azure role show` command to determine the **Id** of the role.

trans-unit.source: Then, use `azure role delete` command to delete the role by specifying the **Id**.
trans-unit.target: Then, use `azure role delete` command to delete the role by specifying the **Id**.

trans-unit.source: The following example removes the *Virtual Machine Operator* custom role.
trans-unit.target: The following example removes the *Virtual Machine Operator* custom role.

trans-unit.source: List custom roles
trans-unit.target: List custom roles

trans-unit.source: To list the roles that are available for assignment at a scope, use the `azure role list` command.
trans-unit.target: To list the roles that are available for assignment at a scope, use the `azure role list` command.

trans-unit.source: The following example lists all role available for assignment in the selected subscription.
trans-unit.target: The following example lists all role available for assignment in the selected subscription.

trans-unit.source: In the following example the *Virtual Machine Operator* custom role isn’t available in the *Production4* subscription because that subscription isn’t in the **AssignableScopes** of the role.
trans-unit.target: In the following example the *Virtual Machine Operator* custom role isn’t available in the *Production4* subscription because that subscription isn’t in the **AssignableScopes** of the role.
